summary: Build a WCA competition-based practice session feature (fetch upcoming competitions from WCA API, filter/search, select competition and event, generate WCA-standard scrambles via external API, store practice data in the browser). Remove all login/signup functionality for now.
architectural_notes: Upcoming competitions data source: official WCA API (external HTTP fetch).
Scramble generation: use an external API to obtain WCA-standard scrambles.
Practice session persistence: client-side only (browser storage such as localStorage/IndexedDB); no canister persistence.
known_issues: Draft app expired and needs rebuild before further changes can be previewed/deployed.

existing_features.title: Remove all login/signup/authentication functionality from the frontend UI so the app is fully usable without any login, including removing or disabling the Login modal, Account modal, and any header/account controls that depend on authentication state.
Add a new Practice Session feature accessible from the main UI (alongside the existing timer experience), with a dedicated entry point labeled “Practice” (English UI text).

On the Practice page, fetch and display the list of upcoming WCA competitions from the official WCA API, and render them in a scrollable list with competition name and location metadata when available.
Provide filtering on the Practice competitions list: (1) filter by country and (2) search by competition name or country name (case-insensitive).
After a competition is selected, display its available events and allow the user to select an event to practice.
On the Practice “ready” page, generate and display 5 random WCA-standard scrambles for the selected event, matching the “Scramble 1/5” style shown in the uploaded reference images.

Persist Practice Session state in the browser only (no canister persistence): at minimum save the selected competition, selected event, generated 5 scrambles, and the user’s current scramble index so that a refresh restores the session.

Apply a coherent dark, competition-focused visual theme consistent across the new Practice flow screens (browse competitions, select event, ready page), using a charcoal/graphite base with high-contrast accents (avoid blue & purple).

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove all login/signup/authentication functionality (email/password and any other login) for now; no login required
Practice Session feature: fetch upcoming WCA competitions from official WCA API; list with filter by country and search by competition/country name; select competition then event
Practice Session ready page: generate 5 random WCA-standard scrambles via an external scramble API for the selected event
Persist practice session data client-side in the browser only (no backend storage)

Remove all email/password authentication logic from the backend canister interface (signup/login/logout/profile session behavior) so the backend no longer exposes or depends on email/password auth for core app usage.

projectName: Remove authentication and add WCA competition-based Practice Session flow (WCA API + 5 scrambles, browser-only persistence)
